TER.TERcoder.WriteFile
Class RecommendedHeader

java.lang.Object
  TER.TERcoder.WriteFile.RecommendedHeader

public class RecommendedHeader
extends java.lang.Object

This class creates a header according to the Recommendation. Usage example:
  construct
  setParameters
  run

Version:
1.1
Author:
Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)

Field Detail

parametersSet

boolean parametersSet
To know if parameters are set.

True indicates that they are set otherwise false.

header

BitStream header
This stream contains the header of the segment

bitDepthDC

int bitDepthDC
Defintion in SegmentCode2D.bitDepthDC

bitDepthAC

int bitDepthAC
Defintion in SegmentCode2D.bitDepthAC

part2Flag

int part2Flag
Indicates for each segment the presence of Part 2 header

Valid values are:

  • 0 - Part 2 header absent
  • 1 - Part 2 header present

part3Flag

int part3Flag
Indicates for each segment the presence of Part 3 header

Valid values are:

  • 0 - Part 3 header absent
  • 1 - Part 3 header present

part4Flag

int part4Flag
Indicates for each segment the presence of Part 4 header

Valid values are:

  • 0 - Part 4 header absent
  • 1 - Part 4 header present

float[] customWeight
Defintion in ForwardWeighting.customWeight

startImgFlag

int startImgFlag
Flags initial segment in an image (component)

Valid values are:

  • 0 - continuation segment in image
  • 1 - first segment in image

endImgFlag

int endImgFlag
Flags final segment in an image (component)

Valid values are:

  • 0 - not the last segment in image
  • 1 - last segment in image

segmentCount

int segmentCount
Indicates the position of the segment inside the encoded image.

run

public BitStream run()
              throws java.lang.Exception
Creates the header for each segment according with the recommendation of CCSDS for image data coding.

Returns:
a bit stream containing the header of each segment
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when something goes wrong and the creation of the header must be stopped
